question: Which among the following is the largest tiger reserve in India?
explanation: Nagarjunsagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve is considered as the largest tiger reserve in India. It was stablished in the year 1983. It spreads over five districts i.e. Kurnool, Prakasam, Guntur, Nalgonda and Mahbubnagar. The total area of the reserve is 3,728 sq km.
